div.head: Gerrard Brown Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen I Gerrard Brown of Charles County in the province
of Maryland being weake in body but in Perfect sense and Memory. Praised be
to Almighty God, First I Bequeath my Soul yo Almight God hoping through
the witness of his bitter death & Passion if he will have Mercy upon my sole
and What small Estate it hath please God to bustow upon me I am Willing it
should be bestowed as followith First bequeath my soul to god & my body to the
Earth Item I bequeath to my son John Brown that Hundred Acres of Land
in Criston templeman. & likewise a gray mare & filly colt that is with hu
at this time & likewise give too two year Old heigers on being called sock Tobacco
& the other none - & fourth plantation that I now live upon I give & bequeath
to my Loving wife Matthew Browne During her Life & likewise the Black Horse
called Jack & likewise I give & bequeath to my said Wife One cow & calf called
Strawberry. Item I give and bequeath to my daughter Jane Browne two sows
on being called Cherry and the other Mad Calf & likewise one black Horse about
a year old with two whole & a Black dorn his Face.

Item I give and bequeath to my Daughter Mary Browne a Hundred & Fifty Acres
of Land called Marchart Wailes Hall. Likewise I give her one young
Horse two years Old being cropt on the left ear & ovor calved on the Right
& likewise I give my said Daughter Mary on Red Cow being of a yellowith
Red
Red, and two yearling brown Heifers. Likewise I give to my Children, John
Brown & Mary Brown two sors a peace, & what
House stuff there is to be Equally dispersed among them all & I give
and Bequeuath to John Godshall my suskehannah gunn if the
said John Godshall haveth and if the said John Godshall Dies I
doe give & bequeath the said Gunn, to Edward Roberts, & further if
Any of my said Children Either John Jane or Mary die before they
be Equally divided between the other share & share at the said for John Brown
if he thinks good to churn his garden, whom he to the full time
of Fourteen years of Age. & I doe further make my loving wife Martha
Brown fuly & soley Executor of this my last will & testament making
Frustering and making void all former wills by me made and
ordaining this to be my last will and testament & so committing
my soul to Almighty God & my body to the Earth, Hoping that my
loving Wife will all things fufilled according to this my will,
as witness this my hand and seal this tenth day of July 1676

Signed seal & Deliv.
In presence of us whom
names are udner written
Thos. Hanson
Edw. Roberts
Gerrard Browne
January 8th 1677

Those same before Henry Adsams. Thomas Allanson & made
oath on the holy Evangelist that he did see Gerrard Brown sign
sign & delivered & publish this to be his last will & testament as
witness my hand & seal the day & year above written
5 1/2 sides
Henry Addams
